verbose_text: Hydroxyurea (HU), an antineoplastic drug used for treatment of HIV, cancer, and myeloproliferative diseases slows the progression of DNA replication machinery by reducing the cell 's deoxyribonucleotide (dNTP) pool.
evidence: Hydroxyurea (HU), an antineoplastic drug used for treatment of HIV, cancer, and myeloproliferative diseases               slows the progression of DNA replication
